snippet: The president huddled with advisers in Virginia not to study facts, but to work on delivering a performance that doesn’t repeat mistakes he made in his first debate with Mitt Romney.
abstract: Pres Obama spends the weekend huddled with close aides in Williamsburg, Va, preparing for the next presidential debate; he is focusing less on facts than on delivering a performance that does not repeat mistakes made in the first round, when he stood passively by as an aggressive Mitt Romney dominated him and turned the campaign upside down.
lead_paragraph: The president huddled with advisers in Virginia not to study facts, but to work on delivering a performance that doesn’t repeat mistakes he made in his first debate with Mitt Romney.

headline.seo: A Serious Debate Prep Session for Obama
headline.main: Obama’s Prep Session Goal: Don’t Repeat Mistakes of Last Debate
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Prep Session Goal: Don’t Repeat Mistakes of Last Debate
